answers.answer: They can put you on meds and monitor it. I would get a diagnoses asap because it can be fatal to mom and baby in later stages and cause other serious complications in the mean time
Agree... Preeclampsia raising your blood pressure sometimes really high which can be really dangerous for you so go ER dnt wait better be safe. Good luck x

It depends on how high your blood pressure is. If you're in the severe range then you need to see a doctor immediately. Call and tell an OB and they will fit you in. My blood pressure has been up to 142/86 since 20 weeks and they're just paying close attention when I go for my visits. What is your blood pressure and symptoms? Also of you're having severe headaches and blurred vision I would go get checked out. If you suspect pre eclampsia a doctor will fit you in. Being only 23 weeks though it's unlikely that you'll need to go to the ER, though definitely not impossible. If it is severe they will put you on hospital bed rest and magnesium to try to prevent stroke and seizures.

Preeclampsia is definitely an ER asap situation. If it progresses to far it can be very very difficult to reverse and become fatal. If you want to talk to a nurse, maybe try calling labor and delivery at a local hospital? I would go the the ER asap though.

question: I haven't been diagnosed with it, but I show many symptoms. I'm not able to see an OB right away, due to moving and being in a new place. I have to set up a new doctor. I'm 23 weeks though. My question is....am I okay to wait a couple weeks to see a doc or is this an ER type of situation?? My understanding is that there really isn't anything they can do for preeclampsia except for possibly early delivery. Is that true?? Any help would be appreciated! Thanks!
title: Preeclampsia question
